verses.roman:
vāyur yathā ghanānīkaṁ
tṛṇaṁ tūlaṁ rajāṁsi ca
saṁyojyākṣipate bhūyas
tathā bhūtāni bhūta-kṛt

synonyms: vāyuḥ—the wind; yathā—as; ghana—of clouds; anīkam—groups; tṛṇam—grass; tūlam—cotton; rajāṁsi—dust; ca—and; saṁyojya—bringing together; ākṣipate—throws apart; bhūyaḥ—once again; tathā—so; bhūtāni—living beings; bhūta—of living beings; kṛt—the creator.
translation: Just as the wind brings together masses of clouds, blades of grass, wisps of cotton and particles of dust, only to scatter them all again, so the creator deals with His created beings in the same way.
